context: The <a3_0>National Hockey League's Carolina Hurricanes<a3_0/> franchise moved to Raleigh in <a0_0><b5_0>1997<b5_0/><a0_0/> from Hartford, Connecticut (where it was known as the Hartford Whalers). The team played its first two seasons more than 60 miles away at <a1_0><b6_0>Greensboro Coliseum<b6_0/><a1_0/> while its home arena, Raleigh Entertainment and Sports Arena (later <b9_0>RBC Center<b9_0/> and now <a2_0>PNC Arena<a2_0/>), was under construction. The Hurricanes are the only major league (NFL, NHL, NBA, MLB) professional sports team in North Carolina to have won a championship, winning the Stanley Cup in <a4_0><b7_0>2006<b7_0/><a4_0/>, over the Edmonton Oilers. The city played host to the <b8_0>2011<b8_0/> NHL All-Star Game.
